tn.text: The author uses [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] throughout this chapter.
Verses 1-15 contrast wisdom and foolishness.
"Any person who"
"the person who does not want to be told what to do"
"is foolish" or "is unwise"

tn.ref: A person cannot be established by wickedness
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT:"No one can become safe and secure by doing what is wicked" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

"Uprooted" represents being pulled out of the ground like a plant or a tree. This cannot happen to those who do right. AT: "are as stable as a tree with deep roots" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: A worthy wife is her husband's crown
tn.text: A crown represents the greatest honor a person can receive. AT: "A good wife is a sign of great honor for her husband." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: she who brings shame is like a disease that rots his bones
tn.text: A disease that rots the bones represents the spoiling of a person's life. AT: "a wife's shameful acts destroy her husband's influence and happiness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: The words of wicked people are an ambush waiting for a chance to kill
tn.text: The deceitful things that wicked people say in order to harm other people are spoken of as if their words are waiting to kill someone by surprise. AT: "The deceitful things wicked people say are like a person who waits to kill someone by surprise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the words of the upright keep them safe
tn.text: "the advice from an upright person keeps people safe"
"the righteous person" or "the honest person" or "the just person"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "People will overthrow the wicked people" or "People will remove the wicked people from power" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The term "house" is often used figuratively in the Bible to refer to a person's ancestors, descendants or other relatives. AT: "family" or "descendants" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: A person is praised by how much wisdom he has
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People will praise those who have wisdom" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the one who makes perverse choices is despised
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "people will hate the one who always thinks evil thoughts" or "people will hate the one who takes good things and twists them into bad" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Better to have an unimportant position
tn.text: "It is better to be an ordinary person"
"causes suffering"
"plans" or "tasks"
This refers to a person's actions and thoughts. Just as fruit on a tree shows what kind of tree it is, in the same way a person's words and actions reveal what his character is like.

tn.ref: An evil person is trapped by his wicked talk
tn.text: "Trapped" represents being caught in a snare or being tricked. This can be stated in active form. AT: "The wicked things an evil person says will trap him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: just as the work of his hands rewards him
tn.text: The phrase, "the work of his hands" represents work done by physical labor. AT: "just as the good work he does rewards him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This phrase represents the idea he has from his own observation, imagination or memory. AT: "in his own opinion" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
wise suggestions
"is wise" or "has good sense."

tn.ref: The words of one who speaks rashly are like the thrusts of a sword
tn.text: The phrase, "thrusts of a sword" represents cruel words that hurt another. AT: "What a person says without thinking can hurt as much as if he stabbed with a sword." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
"Tongue" represents what a person says. AT: "what wise people say" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"comforts and heals"
"Lips" represents what a person says. AT: "A truthful person endures forever" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: a lying tongue is only for a moment
tn.text: "Tongue" represents what a person says. AT: "the one who lies lasts only for a moment" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
those who give recommendations as a guide to action; counselors
The negative, "No" cancels out the idea of "ill" (bad things that happen). AT: "Good things come" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
"Lips" represents what a person says. AT: "Yahweh detests those who tell lies" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"does not tell everything he knows"
"Hand" represents what a person does -- his works. AT: "Diligent people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: will be put to forced labor
tn.text: "Forced labor" describes what a person must do who is not free to do what he wants. AT: "will become a slave" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
uneasy feeling of fear or dread, worry

"Weighing down" represents the idea of putting a very heavy load on a person so he cannot move freely. This phrase means to make a person sad or depressed. AT: "causes him to become sad or depressed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: but a good word makes him glad
tn.text: The abstract noun "word" can be stated as the verb "speak." AT: "but when others speak kindly to him, he is cheerful again" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: would not roast their own game
tn.text: "Game" means animals caught and killed while hunting. And "roast" is a way of cooking food.
"valuable treasure"
